data.scheme_name: Strengthening of Pharmaceuticals Industry-Pharmaceutical Technology Upgradation Assistance Scheme (PTUAS) - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides capital subsidy of upto Rs. 100 lakhs for upgradation of eligible activities.
data.eligibility: All existing units engaged in manufacturing pharmaceutical products are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
The units must invest in eligible activities such as upgrading manufacturing facilities, acquiring new technology, and improving quality control systems.

The expenditure must be certified by a Chartered Accountant and incurred after January 1, 2024.

Existing pharmaceutical units with an average turnover of less than Rs.50000 lakhs over the last three years.

Eligible activities for the subsidy include: Upgrading manufacturing facilities to meet Revised Schedule M and WHO-GMP standards.

Acquiring new technology to improve manufacturing efficiency and quality.

Enhancing quality control systems for product safety and efficacy.

Training programs for workforce skill development.

Investments to ensure environmental compliance.

data.context: This scheme addresses the demand and requirement for support to already existing pharma clusters and MSMEs to improve productivity, quality and sustainability.
data.objective: To facilitate Micro, Small and Medium Pharma Enterprises (MSME) of proven track record to upgrade their technology to meet WHO-GMP or Schedule M standards.
data.description:
Scheme provides capital subsidy to eligible units based on their turnover :

Turnover from Rs.100 lakhs to less than Rs.5000 lakhs: 20% of investment.

Turnover from Rs.5000 lakhs to less than Rs.25000 lakhs: 15% of investment.

Turnover from Rs.25000 lakhs to less than Rs.50000 lakhs : 10% of investment. 

The maximum subsidy amount is Rs. 100 lakhs
data.how_to_apply: Visit the online portal developed by the Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI), the Project Management Consultant (PMC) for the scheme.Register your application at this portal:- https://spi.udyamimitra.in/
data.funding_mechanism:
The applicant will get the incentives are as follows:

1st installment : 50% of eligible amount will be released within 30 days of submitting documents.

Eligible subsidy amount will be released to approved applicant by the DoP on the recommendation of the SSC directly into the bank account of the applicant.
data.additional_info: Revised Schedule M and WHO-GMP are guidelines that ensure pharmaceutical products are produced safely, effectively, and consistently, meeting high-quality standards.Revamped guideline link : https://pharmaceuticals.gov.in/sites/default/files/Guidelines%20PTUAS_0.pdf
